intro: Tephrosia arenicola, commonly known as the sand tephrosia, is a flowering plant native to sandy soils in tropical and subtropical regions. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in open habitats such as coastal dunes and dry forests. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually white or pale yellow, with five petals. Its leaves are compound, consisting of several oval-shaped leaflets. Tephrosia arenicola is known for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor and well-drained soils, making it an important component of certain ecosystems.
